most common species of vs in India all died in less than a decade and the Region's primary scavenger became

um promoting the idea that you know trying to tackle the idea that we can simply substitute U machines in for the

Aviation and I'm going to give you four of her ironies that doesn't mean there's only four it's a little more complicated
than that but you know uh we have 35 minutes so the first one that she identifies is that humans are the
designers of automation yet they're designed often have unanticipated negative consequence for the humans
interacting with that automation the second one is when automation does fail and humans have to
take over they often lack the knowledge or the context to do so so that's because proper knowledge of the system

this kind of knowledge only develops via practical Hands-On feedback with the system and so really the irony here is

when things fail and we know they they will often uh the scale of the tasks you
have to do um is much greater than was imagined for what that automation was
designed for and so this creates new unexpected work for the people because

Parts don't behave as expected sort of leaving more complexity in their wake I don't know if anybody had seen this
